//listing of all techniques and passes with embedded asm listings 

technique TSM3
{
    pass P
    {
        vertexshader = 
            asm {
            
//
            // Generated by Microsoft (R) D3DX9 Shader Compiler 9.15.779.0000
                vs_3_0
                dcl_position v0  // IN<0,1,2,3>
                dcl_texcoord v1  // IN<4,5>
                dcl_position o0
                dcl_texcoord o1.xy
            
            #line 75 "c:\Documents and Settings\Zaknafein\My Documents\Visual Studio 2005\Projects\Bloom\Media\Shaders\Combine.fx"
                mov o0, v0  // ::VS<0,1,2,3>
                mov o1.xy, v1  // ::VS<4,5>
            
            // approximately 2 instruction slots used
            
};

        pixelshader = 
            asm {
            
//
            // Generated by Microsoft (R) D3DX9 Shader Compiler 9.15.779.0000
            //
            // Parameters:
            //
            //   float bloomFactor;
            //   float2 bloomTexCoordOffset[2];
            //   float bloomWidth;
            //
            //
            // Registers:
            //
            //   Name                Reg   Size
            //   ------------------- ----- ----
            //   bloomTexCoordOffset c0       2
            //   bloomFactor         c2       1
            //   bloomWidth          c3       1
            //
            
                preshader
                add r1.xy, c0.xy, c0.xy
                neg r0.xy, r1.xy
                add c0.xy, (1, 1), r0.xy
                add r1.xy, c1.xy, c1.xy
                neg r0.xy, r1.xy
                add c2.xy, (1, 1), r0.xy
                mul r0.xy, c3.x, (-0.166666667, 0.166666667)
                add r1.xy, (0.5, 0.5), r0.xy
                mul r0.xy, c2.x, r1.xy
                mov c3.x, r0.x
                mov c4.x, r0.y
            
            // approximately 11 instructions used
            //
            // Generated by Microsoft (R) D3DX9 Shader Compiler 9.15.779.0000
            //
            // Parameters:
            //
            //   float2 bloomTexCoordOffset[2];
            //   float2 frameBufferTexCoordOffset;
            //   sampler2D sampBloom[2];
            //   sampler2D sampFrameBuffer;
            //
            //
            // Registers:
            //
            //   Name                      Reg   Size
            //   ------------------------- ----- ----
            //   bloomTexCoordOffset       c5       2
            //   frameBufferTexCoordOffset c7       1
            //   sampBloom                 s0       2
            //   sampFrameBuffer           s2       1
            //
            
                ps_3_0
                def c8, 1, 0, 0, 0
                dcl_texcoord v0.xy  // IN<4,5>
                dcl_2d s0
                dcl_2d s1
                dcl_2d s2
            
            #line 111 "c:\Documents and Settings\Zaknafein\My Documents\Visual Studio 2005\Projects\Bloom\Media\Shaders\Combine.fx"
                mov r0.xy, c2
                mad r0.xy, v0, r0, c6
                texld r0, r0, s1  // bloomSamples<3,4,5>
                mul r1.xyz, r0, c4.x
                mov r0.xy, c0
                mad r0.xy, v0, r0, c5
                texld r0, r0, s0  // bloomSamples<0,1,2>
                mad r1.xyz, c3.x, r0, r1  // meanBloom<0,1,2>
                add r0.xy, v0, c7
                texld r0, r0, s2  // frameBufferSample<0,1,2>
                add oC0.xyz, r1, r0  // ::PS<0,1,2>
                mov oC0.w, c8.x  // ::PS<3>
            
            // approximately 12 instruction slots used (3 texture, 9 arithmetic)
            
};
    }
}

                mov oPos, v0  // ::VS<0,1,2,3>
                mov oT0.xy, v1  // ::VS<4,5>
            
            // approximately 2 instruction slots used
            
};

        pixelshader = 
            asm {
            
//
            // Generated by Microsoft (R) D3DX9 Shader Compiler 9.15.779.0000
            //
            // Parameters:
            //
            //   float bloomFactor;

            //   float bloomWidth;

            // Registers:
            //

                neg r0.xy, r1.xy
                add c2.xy, (1, 1), r0.xy

                add r1.xy, (0.5, 0.5), r0.xy
                mul r0.xy, c2.x, r1.xy
                mov c3.x, r0.x
                mov c4.x, r0.y

            //
            // Generated by Microsoft (R) D3DX9 Shader Compiler 9.15.779.0000
            //
            // Parameters:
            //
            //   float2 bloomTexCoordOffset[2];
            //   float2 frameBufferTexCoordOffset;

            //   sampler2D sampFrameBuffer;

            //
            // Registers:

            //   Name                      Reg   Size
            //   ------------------------- ----- ----

            //   frameBufferTexCoordOffset c7       1
            //   sampBloom                 s0       2
            //   sampFrameBuffer           s2       1
            //
            
                ps_2_x
                def c8, 1, 0, 0, 0
                dcl t0.xy  // IN<4,5>
                dcl_2d s0
                dcl_2d s1
                dcl_2d s2
            
            #line 111 "c:\Documents and Settings\Zaknafein\My Documents\Visual Studio 2005\Projects\Bloom\Media\Shaders\Combine.fx"
                mov r0.xy, c2
                mad r1.xy, t0, r0, c6
                mov r0.xy, c0
                mad r0.xy, t0, r0, c5
                texld r1, r1, s1  // bloomSamples<3,4,5>
                texld r0, r0, s0  // bloomSamples<0,1,2>
                mul r1.xyz, r1, c4.x
                mad r1.xyz, c3.x, r0, r1  // meanBloom<0,1,2>
                add r0.xy, t0, c7
                texld r0, r0, s2  // frameBufferSample<0,1,2>

                mov r0.w, c8.x
                mov oC0, r0  // ::PS<0,1,2,3>
            
            // approximately 13 instruction slots used (3 texture, 10 arithmetic)
